content.description: Locate the obvious line of bolts on the steep face just left of a short left facing corner formed by a 25ft pedestal. This pedestal of rock is the start of Ramshackle. Crank past the bolts (11-) to lower angle rock and discontinuous cracks, finding gear placements where you can. Traverse right under a small overhang then straight up on easier terrain past a piton and a final bolt to gain a belay ledge with a bolted anchor. This is the same belay as for the first pitch of Ramshackle. (100ft). Pitch two goes up to a bolt, angles right to another bolt, then continues straight up the beautiful thin headwall slab past a couple more bolts. It's possible to supplement the bolts with an occasional thin nut placement if you look hard enough. (5.10, 65ft). Rock is excellent.
content.protection:
Mostly bolts (1st pitch:6, 2nd pitch:4) with occasional gear placements (small nuts/cams).  

  Decent: 2 single rope rappels from bolted anchors. 60 meter rope required.

content.description: Begin just right of an obvious line of bolts (threadbare) at a short left facing corner with a ledge and small tree at its end. Scramble up to the base of the left facing corner and climb to the ledge/tree and clip a bolt.  Work your way up to another bolt that protects a thin 5.9 section. Continue up on easier terrain past a fixed pin to a final bolt and another 5.9 section to gain a nice ledge with an anchor (100ft). Pitch two goes up slightly left of the anchor to a bolt, then straight up into a nice crack system to the top (5.8, 65ft). Can be done in a single pitch but prepare for rope drag.
content.protection: 4 bolts, a pin, and occasional gear placements (small nuts) on pitch one. The crack on pitch two protects well with nuts and hand sized cams toward the top.    There's a bolted anchor a bit to the right of where the crack tops out.
content.location: Starts in the corner just right of the line of bolts on a dark steep face.    Rappel the route.  Two raps with a single 60 m rope works.

content.description: Super fun and long pitch. From the ledge, climb through some loose blocks with a small tree to the right. Clip a bolt at the base of a shallow groove/chimney and continue up following bolts and occasional gear placements. Climb through some overlaps to gain the slab above zig zagging between the well spaced bolts. Rock is excellent.
content.protection: Mostly bolts (8?) supplemented with an occasional small nut placement. A medium cam (#2 camalot?) is useful about halfway up. Belay from a tree over the top. Watch for loose rocks!
content.location: About 50ft left of Ramshackle.    Rappel from the top anchor for Ramshackle/Threadbare about 50ft to the right(down canyon).

content.description: From the approach ledge, scramble up to a blocky ledge and follow discontinuous cracks and features past a couple of bolts and gear to a 5.10 crux. Shortly after the crux section the climbing eases up significantly and wanders around to the top passing several bolts. A lowering anchor would be useful after the crux section since the remainder of the climb is low 5th class.
content.protection: Mixed bolts (6-7?) and gear placements. Small nuts and cams. Belay from a tree at the top. Be careful of loose rocks at the top out.
content.location: Leftmost route on this wall.  Traverse the ledge, stepping across a narrow spot to the base of the route.    To decend, rappel from the anchors at the cliff top about 100ft to the climbers right. This anchor is the topout for Ramshackle/Threadbare.

content.description: P1 (100ft): Start up dark, chunky rock following discontinuous cracks, angling slightly right. When the crack ends go straight up past two bolts and then angle left across the slab above, skirting the base of a large, detached and precarious looking flake. Clip a fixed pin and continue angling up and left and belay at a bolt on a ledge left of a scrawny pine tree. P2 (65ft): Climb straight up for a bit then angle right over a lower angle section to some intermittent cracks/seams leading up onto the steeper headwall above. Follow these features straight up using any gear opportunities available as there is some ledge fall potential at this point. Continue up a short, thin crack/seam to a piton and on to the clean face above passing two bolts to the top of this beautiful headwall slab. Angle left near the top to end up at the bolted anchor which is also the finish of Threadbare/Ramshackle.
content.protection: 4 protection bolts, 2 pitons, and small to medium gear (mostly nuts)    Bolts for belays
content.location: 30 ft. right of Ramshackle   2 raps from bolts/chains with a 60m rope will get you down.

content.description: Low angle granite wall with a small collection of quality 1-2 pitch routes on great stone high on the east side of the canyon.
